sentence: An earthquake destroyed houses, killed at least three people and injured dozens Thursday in southwest China's Sichuan province.
label: resilience

sentence: Rescue work was underway following the magnitude-6.0 earthquake.
label: resilience

sentence: It struck at 4:33 a.m. local time in Luxian county at a depth of 10 kilometres, the official Xinhua News Agency said.
label: resilience

sentence: State broadcaster CCTV said that 88 people were injured, three seriously, and 35 houses had collapsed.
label: resilience

sentence: The epicentre was about 200 kilometres southeast of Chengdu, the provincial capital.
label: buildings

sentence: Western China is regularly hit by earthquakes.
label: resilience

sentence: A magnitude-7.9 quake in May 2008 left nearly 90,000 people dead in Sichuan, many of them in collapsed schools and other poorly constructed buildings.
label: resilience

sentence: Xinhua reported that collapsed walls and houses could be seen on the way to the epicentre, and that electricity had been suspended in much of Jiaming town.
label: buildings

sentence: Residents could be seen cleaning up.
label: resilience

sentence: Rescue workers were going door-to-door in heavy rain searching for people in damaged homes in Fuji town to move them to temporary shelters, Xinhua said.
label: resilience

sentence: Workers distributed mooncakes, a traditional treat for the next week's Mid-Autumn Festival, and other food at one shelter.
label: resilience

sentence: Lai Jianrong, a Fuji resident, told Xinhua that she felt a mild tremor around 4 a.m. and ran out barefoot in her nightgown when the tremors became intense.
label: resilience

sentence: "Some bricks fell off the wall and I didn't dare to go in again," the agency quoted her as saying.
label: buildings

sentence: More than 3,200 people have been moved to 79 shelters, CCTV said.
label: resilience

sentence: A damaged wall is seen after an earthquake in Luzhou, in China's south-western Sichuan province on Sep 16, 2021.
label: buildings

sentence: (Photo: AFP/STR)
label: other

sentence: BEIJING: Three people were killed and dozens injured when a shallow earthquake struck south-western China on Thursday (Sep 16), triggering the second-highest level of emergency response by rescuers in Sichuan province.
label: resilience

sentence: The quake struck Luxian county before dawn on Thursday around 120km south-west of the sprawling megacity of Chongqing, which along with its surrounding area is home to around 30 million people.
label: resilience

sentence: Rescue workers rushed to lift people from beneath rubble, moving them out of damaged buildings on stretchers, footage from the Sichuan Fire Brigade showed.
label: resilience

sentence: More than a thousand houses in Luxian were reduced to rubble and nearly 30,000 others were damaged, Sichuan authorities said.
label: buildings

sentence: Local media published images of collapsed ceilings in a hospital as residents milled around in the streets after warnings not to return indoors.
label: resilience

sentence: The US Geological Survey put the magnitude of the quake at 5.4 but the China Earthquake Networks Centre measured it at magnitude 6.0.
label: resilience

sentence: Both put it at a shallow depth of 10km.
label: infrastructure

sentence: Sichuan authorities said the seismic event left "three dead, three seriously injured and 85 slightly injured".
label: resilience

sentence: At least 10,000 people have been moved into emergency shelters, according to the county government.
label: resilience

sentence: Footage from Luxian by state broadcaster CCTV showed workers climbing up ladders in pouring rain to remove hazardous debris hanging off buildings, including half-broken panes of glass.
label: buildings

sentence: Students had evacuated their dormitories in the dark earlier on Thursday, clutching umbrellas and wearing backpacks, in another video from the Sichuan Daily.
label: resilience

sentence: Authorities downplayed the immediate threat of a larger aftershock.
label: resilience

sentence: "It is unlikely there will be a larger earthquake in the area in the near future, but aftershocks will continue for some time," Du Bin, deputy chief of the Sichuan Earthquake Administration, told reporters.
label: resilience

sentence: State-run CGTN shared security camera footage showing TVs and refrigerators shaking on the walls of houses as the quake struck, as ornaments smashed onto floors and cracks ran through buildings.
label: buildings

sentence: Bricks were strewn across roads and trees felled in some areas, the images showed.
label: buildings

sentence: Multiple electricity lines were disrupted and 62,000 households were hit by power cuts after the earthquake, the local government in Sichuan said in a Weibo post.
label: resilience

sentence: Traffic on highways passing through the area has been rerouted to make way for emergency vehicles and to avoid damaged roads, the local government said.
label: infrastructure

sentence: China is regularly hit by earthquakes, especially in its mountainous western and south-western regions.
label: resilience

sentence: A powerful 7.9-magnitude quake in Sichuan province in 2008 left 87,000 people dead or missing.
label: resilience

sentence: Among them were thousands of children, killed when poorly constructed school buildings collapsed, but the government failed to release an exact number of dead as the issue took on a political dimension.
label: resilience

sentence: Police detained activists who attempted to count the number of children who had died and mark the buildings that collapsed amid suspicions of poor construction.
label: buildings

sentence: Thursday's quake comes months after a series of strong earthquakes shook sparsely populated areas in north-west and south-west China in May, killing at least two people and injuring dozens.
label: resilience

sentence: BEIJING (AP) — An earthquake destroyed houses, killed at least three people and injured dozens Thursday in southwest China’s Sichuan province.
label: resilience

sentence: Rescue work was underway following the magnitude 6.0 earthquake.
label: resilience

sentence: It struck at 4:33 a.m. at a depth of 10 kilometers (6 miles) in Luxian, a county in the city of Luzhou, the official Xinhua News Agency said.
label: resilience

sentence: State broadcaster CCTV said 88 people were injured, three seriously, and that 35 houses had collapsed.
label: resilience

sentence: The epicenter was about 200 kilometers (120 miles) southeast of Chengdu, the provincial capital.
label: resilience

sentence: Xinhua reported that collapsed walls and houses could be seen on the way to the epicenter, and that electricity had been cut in much of Jiaming town.
label: buildings

sentence: Residents could be seen cleaning up.
label: resilience

sentence: Rescue workers were going door-to-door in heavy rain searching for people in damaged homes in Fuji town to move them to temporary shelters, Xinhua said.
label: resilience

sentence: Workers distributed mooncakes, a traditional treat for next week’s Mid-Autumn Festival, and other food at one shelter.
label: resilience

sentence: Lai Jianrong, a Fuji resident, told Xinhua that she felt a mild tremor around 4 a.m. and ran out barefoot in her nightgown when the tremors became intense.
label: resilience

sentence: “Some bricks fell off the wall and I didn’t dare to go in again,” the agency quoted her as saying.
label: buildings

sentence: More than 3,200 people have been moved to 79 shelters, CCTV said.
label: resilience

sentence: Western China is regularly hit by earthquakes.
label: resilience

sentence: A magnitude- .9 quake in May 2008 left nearly 90,000 people dead in Sichuan, many of them in collapsed schools and other poorly constructed buildings.
label: resilience
